ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned about the nuances of young democracies and the issues that plague them and threaten their success.

I learned, as the title suggest, the challenges young democracies dade. If you are into democratic backsliding and the struggles of building a new democracy, this class really helps in capturing all the different dynamics of that
I learned about the evolution and formation of young democracies. I also learned how to critically analyze research papers.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The readings and topics we discuss are very interesting and engaging. Sometimes I felt like there was too much reading, but overall, great class.

I think the strength of the course is definitely the professor. Prof. De La O is very passionate about the topic and thus, class discussions are always quite interesting and informative. As for weaknesses, I think the density of the readings every week were a bit much given that they were all substantial research papers. Furthermore, many times class discussions would simply be reiterating exactly what experiment was used in XYZ reading or such, and there potentially could be a greater focus on overall theory instead of regurgitating just the readings' content.

Discussions were very interesting! It helps you think like an academic in political science where you really get into the way a study was conducted, the nuances of studies, etc. the Professor always gave very clear and specific feedback on essays which is helpful

Not too many weaknesses, the class was really interesting.

Strengths: The topics for each module were very interesting, and the readings were never boring. Ana was a great professor.
Weaknesses: Seminar tended to be dominated by one or two voices, and participation is a significant part of one's grades, so it often felt as if people were competing to talk.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I'm not sure if breakout rooms are ever successful.
I liked the flexibility of turning in papers when you wanted to
Ana's use of breakout rooms was great

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes! If your interested in studying democracies, democratic backsliding, or democratization, this class is definitely in that realm. Also, if your interested in a career of academia, not that this class will teach you everything, but you do start to get a sense of how to think like an academic

Yes, this is a topic most people do not know much about, so this class is a great way to broaden your worldview. Although many students in the class had some working knowledge of young democracies, it is by no means necessary.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
